image.altText: Anthony Albanese and a blonde woman wearing a blue top and skirt walk beside an air force plane.

props.synopsis: A Labor frontbencher says the government hasn't gone easy on Qantas just because ministers, including Prime Minister Anthony Albanese, have received free upgrades and other perks from the airline.

title.children: Labor minister says PM 'hasn't played favourites' with Qantas despite flight perks

image.altText: A neon sign of an eagle in orange and green words that say "Rivers" affixed to the side of a building.

props.synopsis: Mosaic Brands, the Australian fashion retail company behind clothing brands including Rivers, Katies and Millers, has been placed into voluntary administration.

title.children: Retailer behind Rivers, Katies and Millers enters voluntary administration, putting 3,000 jobs at risk

image.altText: Khadervali Gagguturu wearing sunglasses in a selfie with a plane

props.synopsis: The family of the second pilot, 60-year-old Khadervali Gagguturu, have described him as "fearless" and "brilliant".

title.children: 'Heart of gold': Second pilot identified after horror light plane crash over Sydney

image.altText: David Crisafulli and wife Tegan thank his supporters at his victory party in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Queensland has sent a "decisive" warning to federal Labor, showing that throwing money at cynical voters is no guarantee the love will be reciprocated.

title.children: Jim Chalmers declared the LNP's win 'decisive', countering the existing Queensland election narrative

image.altText: Xiaozheng Lin stands against a grey backdrop in a police mug shot.

props.synopsis: A man who killed two sex workers in the space of 24 hours has struck a deal with prosecutors, allowing him to dodge a murder conviction.

title.children: Man who killed two Melbourne sex workers in 24 hours strikes manslaughter deal

image.altText: Kamala Harris and Donald Trump looking at each other in election illustration

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has headlined a rally at Madison Square Garden and a major newspaper is refusing to pick a winner — here's the latest updates from the US election.

title.children: Trump's Madison Square Garden appearance takes aim at Harris, migrants, Puerto Rico — the latest from the US election campaign trail

image.altText: A McDonald's Qurter Pounger with cheese burger in an open takeaway box alongside a packet of French fries

props.synopsis: Australian law tightly regulates food providers to prevent outbreaks of infection or contamination of produce.

title.children: More US McDonald's customers fall sick with E. coli — could the same thing happen in Australia?

image.altText: A photo of Hoda's 10-year-old nephew smiling. He has black hair.

props.synopsis: Ex-Masterchef contestant Hoda Hannaway's 10-year-old nephew was killed when an Israeli air strike hit a building in Lebanon's capital. Now she worries about the rest of her family's safety.

title.children: Hoda's 10yo nephew in Lebanon was killed by an Israeli air strike. She mourns while fearing for her remaining family

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a dark blue singlet looks into camera with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Police in all Australian states and territories have used a controversial undercover method to catch killers, but there are calls for safeguards to address the risk of wrongful convictions.

title.children: The 'Truman Show' technique Australian police have used to catch more than 20 killers

image.altText: A man in a flower shirt leaves the court room

props.synopsis: The dingo on K'gari made a "gut-wrenching, distressing noise" before bleeding to death, a Queensland court has heard. A 57-year-old man shot the dingo with a spear gun and has been fined $5,000.

title.children: Queensland man sentenced for killing dingo with spear gun on K'gari

image.altText: Two men in suits stand on either side of a woman on the white steps of a large building.

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli has been sworn in as Queensland's premier today, vowing to legislate his key crime policy before the end of the year.

title.children: David Crisafulli sworn in as Queensland premier after LNP wins state election

image.altText: a man in a blue suit holds the hand of a woman in a brown jacket

props.synopsis: Simon Burgess, a two-time Olympic medallist, is given a suspended jail sentence for assaulting his ex-wife in her home in 2023, with the court hearing he was embarrassed about the effect of his conduct on his wider family.

title.children: Dual Olympic rowing medallist avoids further jail after assaulting ex-wife in her home

image.altText: Girl with blurred face dancing in a red tutu with elaborate gold embroidery

props.synopsis: The father of an emaciated girl who was removed from his care after he refused to allow medics to insert a feeding tube told hospital staff he thought BMI "was for fat people" and his daughter was "safe and happy", a Perth court hears.

title.children: Father accused of starving daughter told hospital staff 'there is nothing f***ing wrong with my kid', court hears

image.altText: Lovisa Sjoberg

props.synopsis: Lovisa Sjoberg, 48, was missing in Kosciuszko National Park before being found with a possible snake bite during a search described as looking for a "pinhead in a haystack".

title.children: 'Fortunate to be alive': Photographer found injured after spending nearly two weeks lost in Snowy Mountains

image.altText: A gas platform in the Timor Sea.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest fossil fuel companies is sued by an investor activist group over claims of "greenwashing" its clean energy credentials.

title.children: $22bn company taken to court over claims of 'greenwashing' its environmental targets

image.altText: People standing in mud clearing out homes

props.synopsis: Tropical Storm Trami veers toward Vietnam across the South China Sea after leaving at least 152 people dead and missing.

title.children: Lakeside town in the Philippines ravaged by deadliest of 11 storms to hit country this year

image.altText: Aerial vision of a truck and debris next to a house.

props.synopsis: Four people have died in what police described as a traumatic few days on south-west Victorian roads.

title.children: Four people killed in horror three days on south-west Victorian roads

image.altText: Prabha Kumar, smiling at the camera in a bright pink and gold traditional outfit.

props.synopsis: Prabha Arun Kumar was fatally stabbed while walking through Parramatta Park almost 10 years ago. Police are now offering a million dollar reward to help solve the 41-year-old's murder.

title.children: $1m reward for information that solves murder of mother Prabha Arun Kumar in Parramatta

image.altText: A mobile tower stands tall in the sky, clouds in the background

props.synopsis: Vodafone, Telstra and Optus have officially closed up shop on Australia's 3G network. Here's what will stop working from today.

title.children: The 3G shutdown is starting today. Here are the devices that will not work

image.altText: A close-up shows a man's face next to the label on the outside of a metal chemical drum

props.synopsis: Dozens of neurologists are calling on the Australian chemicals regulator to ban paraquat, a toxic herbicide that has been linked to the development of Parkinson's disease.

title.children: Leading neurologists say evidence linking paraquat with Parkinson's disease is 'very strong', and they want it banned

image.altText: The Mackay Base Hospital seen from an airplane window

props.synopsis: The Mackay Hospital and Health Service says a $8.12 million review has led to significant change, but women who were affected by "inadequate care" at the hospital's gynaecology and obstetrics unit say there is still more work to be done.

title.children: Women affected by 'inadequate care' at Queensland hospital say there's 'still a long way to go' to trust health service

image.altText: A graduate holds on to his hat while talking on his mobile phone

props.synopsis: More than 1,000 workers could soon lose their jobs as Australia's universities aggressively cut costs ahead of the federal government's proposed international student caps.

title.children: 'The community thinks we've lost our way': International student cap exposes university business model

image.altText: A group of Wallabies players wearing blue shirts complete a run during

props.synopsis: The 10th-ranked Wallabies are wisely opting against making any bold promises ahead of only the third grand slam tour of the UK since 1984.

title.children: Wise Wallabies making no promises for grand slam tour

image.altText: A Geelong AFLW player on one knee in the goalsquare raises a fist in celebration after kicking a goal.

props.synopsis: The AFLW has had an influx of Irish talent in recent years, with the new talent helping change the game.

title.children: 'We don't get that at home': How the lure of the AFLW is helping Irish players change the game

image.altText: A man stands in the doorway of an outbuilding, looking on.

props.synopsis: The rolling green hills and lush forests of Serbia's Jadar Valley make for an idyllic scene, but below the surface lies Europe's largest lithium deposit, and a proposal to mine it has put nature, money, power, and livelihoods at stake.

title.children: Rio Tinto's bid for Serbia's 'white gold' sparks international saga

image.altText: A crowd of densely packed Palestinian people in distress reach for an open bakery window

props.synopsis: As an Israeli offensive in the north of the Gaza Strip enters a fourth week, local residents say they are starving as aid convoys are blocked from reaching them.

title.children: 'Conditions of life untenable' in northern Gaza, UN says, as dozens killed in one day

image.altText: A woman looks with at the camera with her hands up, smiling. She has big headphones on and a sign which says ABC Radio Sydney.

props.synopsis: The journalist has taken the broadcaster to the Federal Court after she was taken off air part way through a radio presenting stint on ABC Radio Sydney last December. It came after she shared a social media post on the war in Gaza.

title.children: ABC to argue that chief content officer was 'decision-maker' in Antoinette Lattouf's sacking

image.altText: A man stands next to a vehicle loaded with ammunition

props.synopsis: More than 120 civilians have been killed by Sudan's Rapid Support Forces paramilitary in a multi-day attack denounced by the UN and aid groups.

title.children: UN decries 'atrocious' human rights violations in Sudan after paramilitary's mass killing of civilians

image.altText: Nikkita Azzopardi, pictured smiling at a party.

props.synopsis: The brother of a woman found dead in Melbourne’s north-east has spoken of his family’s shock and grief, with police arresting a 33-year-old man in relation to her death.

title.children: Brother speaks of his family's shock and grief, as police arrest man over woman's death

image.altText: Close-up of Gina Chick with closed mouth, slightly smiling, with chin held slightly raised. Brown furry coat just visible.

props.synopsis: Gina Chick's sheer love of life is inspiring. Now she wants to use the profile she's gained from winning SBS's Alone Australia to help others appreciate the "wild adventure of life".

title.children: She was called 'too much' but Gina Chick wouldn't make herself small. Now she's helping others live big, too

image.altText: Two hands hold a light-pink ceramic piggy bank full of coins.

props.synopsis: Small improvements in your superannuation's performance or fees can make a significant difference in retirement.

title.children: Checking these three factors with your super has 'huge financial implications'

image.altText: A creek after rain runs horizontal at the bottom of an image in a red gorge.

props.synopsis: WA's Aboriginal affairs minister has shocked Equinox Resources by declining an application to begin drilling near Karijini National Park, a move welcomed by traditional owners.

title.children: Miner flags legal action as WA government knocks back drilling proposal near Karijini

image.altText: A shopping precinct in central Geelong with police tape in the foreground.

props.synopsis: A 26-year old man has been charged over the fatal stabbing of another man in Geelong in the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: Mother pays tribute to 'beautiful son', as police charge man over Geelong stabbing

image.altText: Dark roof with solar panels

props.synopsis: The polling shows solid support for negative gearing and capital gains tax changes, but stronger support for more supply and first home buyer grants.

title.children: Voters prefer housing supply over negative gearing restrictions, polling suggests as Labor cools on reform
